meanings.sent1: The banjaxed toy lay in pieces on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The old car was banjaxed beyond repair.
meanings.sent3: After the clumsy cat knocked over the vase, it looked banjaxed.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt banjaxed after the painful breakup.
meanings.sent5: The banjaxed bridge could no longer bear the weight of the heavy truck.

meanings.sent1: He stumbled out of the bar, completely banjaxed.
meanings.sent2: The banjaxed man had trouble speaking clearly.
meanings.sent3: The banjaxed partygoer mistook a potted plant for a person.
meanings.sent4: Her banjaxed mind struggled to focus on anything.
meanings.sent5: The banjaxed sailor swayed unsteadily on the deck of the ship.

meanings.sent1: The team looked banjaxed after losing the championship.
meanings.sent2: She felt banjaxed by the amount of work piled on her desk.
meanings.sent3: The banjaxed chess player resigned after a series of bad moves.
meanings.sent4: The banjaxed army retreated in disarray.
meanings.sent5: The banjaxed student struggled to keep up with the fast-paced lecture.
